Early Access Review
								Great game, using boost to make perfect drifts is like a dream that becomes true! I really love all the graphics, cars and their parts are very nice looking, and I feel highly involved into the race.I see a lot of potential here and I can't wait to start my career. Shut up and take my money! :D

Early Access Review
								This game is awsome !!! Much better than other racing Games !!! But for the future i would like to see:-Parts being unlocked when winning a Race (example: Hyber Speedway with 3 laps and Manual Transmission to win the new bumper)-more Tracks-better Performance-better Handling-more Parts in totalBut exept that its the best Game i ever played since i bought Minecraft and Scrap Mechanic :)

Early Access Review
								So firs off I'd like to say im so glad this game is finally out, ive been following development for a while, saying as this is early access I have noticed some things that need some work, but overall the game has a lot of potential! The visuals are stunning and the art style is really cool. as I mentioned in my email this morning, the controls do need a touch of work, (coming from someone playing on a keyboard). I really do love the game and I cant wait to see where it goes!

Early Access Review
								Great game! Very pretty considering it's early access state, and they're going to allow you to 3D print your cars which is super neat and a pretty new concept in gaming. Has a lot of promise and i'm excited to see what else they have in store to come. Not super realistic controls but like I said, early access, and i'm sure it'll improve as they develope. Here's a look at it so far

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ignore the thumbs down and read what I'm thinking 'cause even if I have to give it a thumbs down it's not what I want to do...The thing is that I love racing games, have played all the NFS's up 'til Shift (and some after, hate the newest BTW...) I've played all the Forza's apart from 6 (felt weird and too gimmicky) and so on and this game's not for me or you if you're like me.This game I feel is for the Trackmania crowd/type of gamers, it lacks in proper responce as far as the thumbstick goes and you can't (not without changing some settings at least) use the D-pad instead so I do think that the KBD is the best way to play and that you need to know how to use it properly to enjoy it.So that's why I give it a thumbs down, not due to it being a bad game but due to being a game I didn't expect it to be and made for people who aren't like me so I do wish Steam had up/down/Not my kind of game...Yeah, come to think of it, let's end on a positive note, it did run very well on my Phenom II 955/8 GB RAM/R9 285 box @ 1080p, I did put the graphics to the highest setting. (I didn't bother with AA and such though)
